intro: Centropogon fimbriatulus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved centropogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, opposite leaves with a serrated edge. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in small inflorescences, and bloom during the wet season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and rocky habitats.
